stories.text:
What is the best way to do an urgent public service announcement a corporate-funded spammer/scammer who abused the Who Wants To Be Hired thread by harvesting emails and sending obvious spam mail?

It is not an individual act from an individual person but a corporate-funded spammer/scammer.

Is there also a way to sticky this information about this spammer/harvester/scammer onto the Who Is Hiring thread and Who Wants To Be Hired thread?

PSA: Do not click on any of the links to "unsubscribe" because it tells the spammer/scammer that your email address is a valid email address.

PSA: Add these domains and email addresses to your spam mail list:

- optimhire dot com

- OptimHire <jobs.invite at optimhire dot com>

- OptimHire <partners at optimhire dot com>

- myremotedevelopers dot com

- contactus@myremotedevelopers dot com

The spam they are sending is against the law in California.

From the website of Rob Bonta, Attorney General:

- California law prohibits unsolicited commercial email ads in California. (Bus. & Prof. Code § 17529.) An email ad is unsolicited if you have not given direct consent to receive ads and you don’t have a preexisting or current relationship with the advertiser.

- California law also prohibits commercial email ads in California that:

    - Have a subject line that a person knows would be likely to mislead a reasonable recipient about a material fact about the contents or subject matter of the message.
- It is vital to note that the law holds advertisers, not just Spammers, liable for violation of the law:

    1. Private parties receiving such e mail may sue for damages, attorneys fees and costs.

    2. If the advertisement violates the above provisions, liquidated damages of one thousand dollars per advertisement (with a cap of one million dollars per incident) are available.

    3. The new law also grants California electronic mail service provides (including ISPs) the right to bring their own civil actions, including liquidated damages of up to twenty five thousand dollars per day against advertisers that violate the provider’s policies of unsolicited electronic mail advertisements.
More about this spammer/harvester/scammer:

- On Trustpilot: review/myremotedevelopers

- On Trustpilot: reviews/5f1d13471a5a69071c95c5d0

- On Trustpilot: reviews/5ee263b57dd753070880fbc9

- On Trustpilot: reviews/5e8998ab086b6409bc7d872b

- On Trustpilot: reviews/5e85e32e086b6409b0e58660

- On Crunchbase: organization/optimhire

The corporate spammer/scammer even wrote an annual salary range the started from below minimum wage. For a manager role. Their pitch:

``` Who Are We Our Client is a fast-growing start-up on a mission to create more equality in the world by empowering all individuals to pursue their entrepreneurial spirit. There platforms connect businesses with the best factories, giving them easy access to reliable inventory and capability to easily design and manufacture inspiring products. Our headquarters are in Los Angeles, California, but they are a truly global company with team-members across the U.S., Europe, and Asia/Pacific.

Specifically Looking for: ● Strong management skills

● Willing to jump in and write code

● This is a “manager” role - someone who will be directly managing the engineering team

This job is not Relevant to you?

Don’t worry! We Have 36,265+ Matching jobs

Get Jobs Fast

Training at 7:00 pm IST (Monday to Friday)

You’re receiving this email because you signed up on Optimhire dot com for alerts

MyRemoteDevelopers Inc, 4344 Fellow ST. Union City CA 94587 USA -> Probably fake address ```

Their real company address is in Hyderabad, Telangana, India

OptimHire Software Solutions Pvt Ltd , 3rd Floor, Adarsha Villa, Road No. 1, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad -500004
stories.title: Ask HN: What's best way for urgent PSA of WhoIsHiring corporate spammer/scammer?
